controls:

  • click + drag: reposition point
  • type letter or click: place point
  • ctrl/meta + drag: arrow
  • Alt: start Tarjan's alg animation

    • important note:
    Why did I implement an algorithm to find strongly connected components (SCCs) and not just do a topological sort on the DAG produced by DFS? Because SCCs do not depend on the traversal. There can be many DAGs that span a graph, but only one SCC equivalence relation. I hope this makes it so I can get the SCCs for the whole graph ahead of time, instead of computing a spanning DAG on every update.
